intro: Acioa dolichopoda, commonly known as the long-headed acacia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in dense clusters, and it produces elongated, fibrous pods that contain seeds. Acioa dolichopoda is often found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
